lexUnit.name: declare.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: announce solemnly or officially; make clearly known.

sentence.text: An epidemic is only declared when the number of cases reaches more than 100 per 100,000 .
It is , however , beyond doubt that the overwhelming majority of Cabinet ministers interviewed declared unequivocally that they believed that she could not win .
I declare here , once for all , I describe not men , but manners ; not an individual , but a species "
Rosa chuckled , then declared solemnly , ` I suppose you 're old enough by now .
Navarro Wolff declared AD/M-19 to be in a state of emergency and it was reported that its leaders had been concentrated in one place to resist arrest .
My dad gave him the sort of look that only someone declared clinically dead can manage .
The Princess , he declared , was ` very accomplished , a very sensitive player and shows great musical ability .
It was simply a question , Fred declared , of having ` a nose for news " and added that only a competent reporter could make a good story out of unlikely ingredients .
` You would n't catch me in there ! she declared , and the girls giggled .
` Simon Cooper , " Simon promptly declared , and looked expectant .
" I want to do something about it ! " declared Ellen Harker in thrilling tones .
'The man is a Philistine , " declared Gamal .
Already another major cosmetics manufacturer has declared an interest in adopting a similar system
They both started by declaring a moratorium on building for the civil service , so time went by and little advance was made .
In many areas hospitals have declared themselves on ` Yellow Alert " .
Who knows , if things get really out of hand , maybe the warring crack gangs of Oakland 's ghettos may be moved to declare a truce for the duration .
First , however , I have to declare myself in favour of the general principle of a national curriculum , which has been described by Kenneth Baker as the central feature of the new Act .

The new military authorities in Ciskei immediately declared themselves in favour of reintegration into South Africa ; they also announced that trade unions , banned under Sebe , would be allowed to function .
Estonia and Latvia declared independence on Aug. 20 and 21 respectively ( Lithuania having done so on March 11 , 1990 -- see p. 37300 ) .
Coventry Cathedral Priory declared possessions worth 500 , but its debts left it 52 in the red ; similarly its net income was less than a quarter of the gross .
Finance ministers declared their opposition to devaluation .
Mr Shekhar has declared his undying loyalty to the new government , without revealing whether he would join it .
Failure to declare a find of treasure to a local coroner would carry a maximum one month jail sentence or a fine of up to 5000 .
In the 1970s , the Financial Accounting Standards Board declared its intention to become involved .

The regime declares itself to be the only true guardian of socialism , but can offer no answer to what is happening elsewhere except to denounce foreign interference and to assert that communism must inevitably triumph .

And landlords and people of substance , who might normally offer charitable relief of their own , would certainly guard their purses as long as the government declared itself to be the great provider .
Since then , however , Meciar appeared to be more reluctant and declared in the same Le Monde interview : " We do n't want independence .
Already , in the regna assigned to Charles at Orlans , a number of important men had declared for Lothar .
Servia declared against mediation .
Is it true the things that you 've been declaring about yourself ?
At the end of the play she had declared to Crowe her ambition to be an actress .
On a sudden impulse she declared to her father that she was going out .
Irina was wearing a blue-and-brown check low-waisted summer dress with pleats , which Alison had already declared to Franca to be ` too smart , too old , and too expensive " .
` I 'll make her my wife , " he declared to himself , ` or I 'll never be able to concentrate on work again ! "
` You appear to have changed , " she declared icily to Silas .
` I declare to you , Spilsby , I was never so browbeaten !
` The condom is not the devil 's raincoat , " he declares .
` You could be something fine , " he declared , surprising her completely .
On May 27 , declares the press release for James Whitaker 's new book , ` a major news story is going to break concerning the marriage of the Prince and Princess of Wales . "
Edward declared he could not continue to be king without the women he loved .
For instance , in Leeds it was the Conservative leader who intervened in a press debate and it was declared that , ` His attitude is anti-fascist and anti-communist . "
Art dealer John Bowes-Lyon , a cousin of the Queen , was declared bankrupt .
War had been declared .
Martial law had recently been declared in Sudan which meant that all Sudanese nationals abroad required a visa to return home .
North Korea countered by declaring that South Korean nuclear facilities should also be subject to inspection .
Both sides declared that the treaty thus contained , for the first time , an " honest " interpretation of the 1968 events .
Bell opted out of the tour , but declared himself available for internationals , and can expect extra attention on Sunday from the Kiwi centres .
The boys declared it a feast compared with the week before and polished off their chocolate as a bonus .
Turnout was given as 1,364,788 , or 72.2 per cent of all eligible voters , with 1,341,247 voting in favour , 20,409 voting against , and 3,132 votes declared invalid .
Hairdressers , for instance , are permitted to work from home -- providing they declare their income .

Lloyds , which declared pre-tax losses of 715,000,000 the highest in Europe made provisions covering 85 per cent of its medium-and long-term debt , while National Westminster covered 72 per cent of its total debt .
